Package com.rubynaxela.kyanite.game

Class Scene

java.lang.Object
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.game.RenderLayer
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.game.Scene
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<org.jsfml.graphics.Drawable>
public abstract class Scene extends RenderLayer
Provides a scene that can be given a custom behavior and displayed on a Window.

  • Constructor Details

    • Scene

      public Scene()

  • Method Details

    • empty

      public static Scene empty()
      Creates a "null" scene with empty RenderLayer.init() and loop() methods.

    • fullInit

      @Contract("-> fail") public final void fullInit()
      Performs the full scene initialization, i.a. starts the global clock and calls the RenderLayer.init() method. This method should not be invoked manually.

    • loop

      protected abstract void loop()
      This method is executed every frame by the window it belongs to.

    • fullLoop

      public final void fullLoop(@NotNull @NotNull Window window)
      Calls the loop() method and then every entity is animated (if it implements AnimatedEntity) and drawn on the game window. This method is automatically executed every frame by the window it belongs to and should not be invoked manually.
      Parameters:
      window - the window that the scene has to be displayed on

    • getDeltaTime

      public org.jsfml.system.Time getDeltaTime()
      Gets the time that has passed between the previous and the current frame. Calling this method during the first frame of the scene will return time estimated by the window framerate limit as there was no previous frame time to compute the difference.
      Returns:
      time between the current and the previous frame

    • isSuspended

      public boolean isSuspended()
      Returns:
      whether the execution of this scene's loop is suspended

    • suspend

      public void suspend()
      Suspends the execution of this scene's loop. Note that if a HUD's animated behvior relies on this scene's loop, it will be suspended as well.

    • resume

      public void resume()
      Resumes the execution of this scene's loop. The getDeltaTime() method called right after this method will return time estimated by the window framerate limit.
